snippet: Products manufactured in China and purchased in the United States steal American jobs and harm the environment, among other hidden costs.
abstract: Op-Ed article by economics and public policy Prof Peter Navarro contends $34 million in steel production and fabrication work for renovation of Verrazano-Narrows Bridge in New York City, which has been outsourced to China, is a symbol of China's assault on the American economy; details costs involved in having products manufactured in China and purchased in the United States, which include stealing American jobs and harm to the environment.
lead_paragraph: Products manufactured in China and purchased in the United States steal American jobs and harm the environment, among other hidden costs.
